website_summaries.verdict: The Canon CanoScan LiDE110 Color Image Scanner is aimed at people who want to scan photographic prints without paying extra for a film scanning feature they don't need.
cons: Extremely limited features in bundled software

customer_reviews.title: Great option for a low volume scanner at a good price point
customer_reviews.text: I needed a cheap scanner to use from my home office a few times a month, and this fits the bill. The speed isn't bad, quality is good, software isn't any worse than any other scanner I've used, and it works without a power supply. One note... don't lose the USB cable that comes with it, it wouldn't for me with a third party cable, but otherwise it's a good buy. It sits on shelf and gets plugged in when needed, and I've had no issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Not suitable for Linux
customer_reviews.text: At the time I bought this, I needed a low-cost scanner for infrequent use with my Linux-based computer. I checked the SANE website; this scanner was "fully supported". Unfortunately, there seems to be some (unspecified) plumbing or configuration that's necessary on per-distro basis; I was never able to get this scanner to function on my Fedora Linux installations for more than one or two scans at a time. I guess I should have paid attention to comments regarding Canon's indifference toward open-source software. Regardless, I'm sure that this could be a fine peripheral when used on a platform supported by Canon's official software.
customer_reviews.author: David Lamkins

customer_reviews.title: NO MORE CANON SCANNERS FOR ME!!!
customer_reviews.text: Hardly used this scanner. Purchased new on Jan. 16, 2014 from Amazon and loved it. Used it for our taxes in April 2015. Didn't really use it again until April 2016 and got the "Locked, etc." message. Tried everything...looked for solutions all over the Internet...even hooked it up to hubby's computer (I have a laptop, and...yes...tried different USB ports...re-installed it with the CD...used the original cable that was provided with purchase, etc., etc., and etc.). Finally put it by the curb with the installation CD, and someone took it for parts. NO MORE Canon scanners for me!
customer_reviews.author: Janice Aube Titus

customer_reviews.title: Works smoothly
customer_reviews.text: My old scanner bit the dust when I upgraded to Windows 7. Well, it still works, but there is no software drivers. For low-volume scanning, this unit really works well. And, it has some software controlled buttons that are most useful. We regularly use the scanner as a copier, and this has a button that scans and automatically prints to the default printer. (Be careful about multiple scanning/printings. It remembers the setting, and you can get 10 copies when you want one. --Personal Experience--) It also has the ability to scan multiple items at once, and automatically separate them for separate usage. That is nice when trying to digitize old photos.
customer_reviews.author: JohnD

customer_reviews.title: Blurry scans, HUGE file sizes
customer_reviews.text: I tried to get this as just a very basic scanner for my home office when I went online during the pandemic. It's proven to be absolutely frustrating. The scans are ALWAYS blurry. Always. Even when I out up the dpi. Worse yet, the resulting files are GYNORMOUS! There seems to be no sensible way to scan a simple piece of paper and have it be a reasonable resulting file size. I'm very frustrated and upset by this product.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: It's cheap and sufficient
customer_reviews.text: If this were advertised as a premium scanner, it would be a one or two star product. Scanned documents come in a little too dark, it takes several seconds to scan anything, and the scan quality is not as good as the resolution would indicate (yeah, it probably hits the advertised resolution, but the image noise sort of wipes that out). However, this thing is incredibly cheap. We mostly use it to archive documents that we are on the border between keeping/shredding. So, for a great price, this has saved us some storage space and hopefully will save us quite a bit of hassle when it comes time to retrieve one of those old documents too.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Excellent scanner I am very pleased with it
customer_reviews.text: Excellent scanner I am very pleased with it. I had to finally scrap my HP officejet r80 because it would not work with windows 7 64 bit. and nobody could tell me how to get it to work twain drivers were missing. So I bought this scanner because i seen cannon had win 7 64 bit drivers on their website before i made the purchase i checked other comments online and everyone said this scanner worked with win 7 64 bit so i gave it a try and I am very pleased. it is totally automatic i don't have to preview and manually set it to scan like my old scanner it does it all and is so fast....
customer_reviews.author: R. J. Marks

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is easy to use and is great for scanning photos. I have scanned 10000+ photos and it keeps scanning great. Like everything, if you take care of it, it will last. Make sure the scanner is unlocked before using (slider on bottom). Don't let the scanner get knocked around or dropped (obviously). And have a clean hand towel (soft) to wipe dust off the photos before you put on scanner. Also have a piece of paper near by when you're scanning because it can be a great photo scooper to get the pictures off the scanner so you don't leave finger prints on scanner. (If scanner glass is not clean, it will show up on the scan)
customer_reviews.author: Jedi-MANda

customer_reviews.title: Great so far but just got it! Perfect for scanning photos!
customer_reviews.text: I read lots of bad reviews on this scanner but chose to give it a try since its the best seller. So far so good. Connects like a breeze. Software isn't really user friendly but luckily it has the one touch buttons that are amazing. The auto scan button is so so perfect for scanning photos. It sizes them perfectly and saves them as the correct file type. It is so nice to just through a photo in there and have it scanned to its fullest potential save as the right file type and no worries about have to be cropped. So far a big fan especially with the price.
customer_reviews.author: kyle

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner, simple to use
customer_reviews.text: Still have this after 4+ years, very easy to use. Software is very simple, scan quality is high. Great for scanning flat objects, however even objects that have folds for example can still be scanned (just the fold marks can be present in the scan).
customer_reviews.author: Adam P.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Canon CanoScan easy to use but bundled software cood be better.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this is a nice, easy to use scanner. I purchased it when my all-in-one printer/scanner stopped scanning. Easy to use, especially the one button PDF output. Since it is powered from the USB port, no external power supply is necessary. It is small enough that it is easy to move to any system in the house. Scan quality is good for what we use it for, which is mostly scanning for archive purposes and school projects. The software that somes twith the scanner is a little confusing regarding where the images are saved to. As I own an Adobe license, this is not an issue for me, as my post processing is done in Adobe and Photoshop.
customer_reviews.author: Steven Veerhoff

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner for the price
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased this scanner it was around just $50. I was hoping that since it was a Canon, it would scan good quality. And it does - of course you get several choices of scan quality, but I have not yet been disappointed. If I didn't like the quality I saw, I just changed the settings. It is slow, for sure, being just a table top, low price scanner, but it is easy to use, loading of and using the software is a breeze, and the unit is small enough to easily put away on a shelf when not in use. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Love the Birds

customer_reviews.title: Great scanner at a great price
customer_reviews.text: As a whole this is a pretty great scanner. It's very thin and scans very clearly. Plus the price was very reasonable considering other scanners of this size tend to run for a higher price. Pros: - very slim - very light - scans come out crisp and clear - the software is easy to use Cons: - the included software is usable, but lacks the option to disable a particular window from popping up after a scan completes Other thoughts: - It almost looks like a slightly thick laptop when it's closed and sitting on my desk
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Canon has been a solid brand for me.......til now...
customer_reviews.text: This scanner came in a crushed box, no safety package marking.....the scanner lid is warped, the seal foam crushed...so i had to fix /jury rig that....... with a weight placed on top it does work.
customer_reviews.author: Michael R. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Scanner for on the Go
customer_reviews.text: Love this scanner, gives good resolution and is compact enough for mobile work. Just plug it in and it works. The software lets you scan multiple images into separate pictures under windows with few exceptions the image processing went well. I mostly do my work under Linux so I was happy that it was compatible with my Mint Linux. I am still experimenting on how to duplicate the multiple image separation scans under Linux, but overall I am very pleased with my scanner. I would happily recommend this scanner to any one who just wants a simple no hassles scanner that is compact for common 1 page jobs.
customer_reviews.author: A. Rodarte

customer_reviews.title: Scans crooked
customer_reviews.text: Enough to drive you crazy. I have had two of this model and one of the previous version. They apparently all do this. If you need to scan documents with lots of vertical and horizontal lines near the outside of the page, you can easily see that the final scan is not straight (although the original is perfect and lined up on the scanner glass. Went through everything possible with Canon with no resolution. Amazon was great though with the returns. Don't buy this for scanning those type of docs if that matters to you. Otherwise the scanner is fine but this is a big design flaw. Very disappointed with Canon.
customer_reviews.author: Dwyatt

customer_reviews.title: Best flatbed scanner I have bought.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this more often than I expected, simply because if the ease with which I am able to plug it in, start up the supplied software, scan (after setting the one click options) and put it back, all within less than 2 minutes. Though I will caution those without externally powered USB slots that you may have issues getting this thing to warm up correctly. Be sure you are getting the correct power out of your USB, as this is a USB powered device. On that note, I use my monitors USB slots, as they are the most consistent.
customer_reviews.author: Tj

customer_reviews.title: 2 for 2 On Defective Scanners and Support for Windows 7 is Terrible
customer_reviews.text: I bought this scanner as a Christmas present. The first one I had came with a chip in the scanner surface. Canon replaced it with a refurbished unit and the replacement also has problems. It puts a dark line down the middle of pictures. The included software and Canon support are terrible to work with. The software troubleshooting directions and technical support instructions refer to things that do not exist in Windows 7. I don't have any problems scanning high resolutions with my all-in-one printer and am experienced with computers, so the problem is not my computer. I can't recommend this scanner to anyone at any price. There are too many things that can go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: Colleen K.

customer_reviews.title: Very nice scanner
customer_reviews.text: The scanning software is a bit odd to use. Sometimes I cannot not figure out how to do things I have done before. However, once you figure out the option that lets your scan multiple pictures and automatically splits them into separate files, you will be so happy. I bought this scanner mainly to scan a bunch of family photos that my family did not have archived anywhere. I was terrified a fire would destroy the only copies. So, this feature alone saved me so much time. It also stores everything you scan temporarily until you say you are done and decide where to file everything on your hard drive.
customer_reviews.author: Katya

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: I've had this scanner now for 9 months, and I can say that it has held up very well in that time under moderate usage, and I would highly recommend it. Pros: relatively thin and lightweight, easy setup with single USB cable (no separate power cable), customizable buttons, excellent value for the price, good image quality Cons: Included software can be frustrating at times, sheets load upside down for some reason, occasionally loses button functionality (restored by unplugging and replugging USB), easily movable but would not recommend for frequent traveling (seems somewhat fragile)
customer_reviews.author: Overpanic

customer_reviews.title: But Something Else Instead
customer_reviews.text: This scanner on the Mac just doesn't work if you have two accounts. Whichever account you load up first, it associates to that account. Then if you switch to another account, it says it's in use and won't let you use it. Scanning photos on it isn't good because you can see all the dust particles on the photo even though I cleaned it as clean as can be. I'm assuming dust got inside the scanner which makes it impossible to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Rex Martin

customer_reviews.title: Favorite brand scanner!
customer_reviews.text: After spending much of my life in the graphic design world, I've used expensive scanners and cheap ones. Now that my job doesn't require a $3000.00 scanner, I prefer this one. I've had Epsons but this one rocks. It's small, light, fast and powers with only 1 USB cord. Can mount vertically as well as horizontally. This is one that IF I had to take it somewhere I would, it's so light. Now is this the best for photos, not bad but probably not the best providing that you're not a professional photographer. I'm sure it would do perfectly for people like my mom who's scanning of photos isn't a business. Great scanner and love the whole LiDE line.
customer_reviews.author: MmSean

customer_reviews.title: Awesome scanner!
customer_reviews.text: This little simple scanner works so well, and the price is right! I needed one at home and didn't want to spend a fortune. I'm a big fan of Canon products and know their electronic image devices are wonderful, so I decided to buy this one. The images are sharp and clear, and the scan time is short. Of course, this one scans only one page at a time, so if you want a higher capacity scanner you'd have to buy a different model. But I can certainly attest to the crisp, high resolution images that Canon is so known for. Go for it!
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: Canon makes very solid scanners
customer_reviews.text: I have owned one of the IDE line scanner in the past and was very pleased with it. I like the USB-powered design, as I already have a dozen wall worts. Driver installation was straightforward, worked immediately, and the default quality was good. The one-touch PDF is a very handy feature as well. Driver included has a number of user-adjustable settings. If you can't get what you want from them, you are far too demanding. The initial color scan on default was a bit pale, but a minor adjustment to the contrast and saturation fixed that. If you need a very good scanner at an excellent price, look no further.
customer_reviews.author: M. B. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Adequate as a scanner
customer_reviews.text: I got the scanner because I upgraded my Photoshop from CS 2 to CS 6. The older CanoScan scanned directly into my Photoshop Program (CS 2), but did not scan into my upgrade. I did not know how to make it scan into CS 6, so purchased this later model. After installing it I found that it did not scan into CS 6 directly either, so in a way it was I just put out $$ for something I did not need. It is adequate, but no improvement over my older scanner. I regret buying it. However, if I did not have a scanner, this model works OK, but not as simple or as convenient as the older model.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa Boersig

customer_reviews.title: Works well with Linux
customer_reviews.text: I can confirm that it works well with Linux. I have a Debian testing laptop, and use this scanner with it through simple-scan. I haven't needed to install any drivers or other packages, simply plugging it in, running simple-scan, and then selecting the scanner in simple-scan is enough. The scanner can get rather good quality scans, and with simple-scan you can generate both jpegs or pdfs. So I would definitely recommend this to anyone who intends to use it on Linux.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Todd

customer_reviews.title: Canon scanner error code 520252 solution
customer_reviews.text: I have had this scanner for less a year, works great. However today I tried to use it and it's not working, an error message indicates an internal error with code 520252. Tried it on a different PC, same issue. Both Pcs are Windows 7. Windows tried to update the driver online but claims newest driver is already installed. I thought the scanner is gone. Then I went to Canon official website and found out there is driver dated Oct12, 2012. After installation of this driver, the scanner works again. My guess is some recent Windows update messed up things. So any of you have the same issue, maybe this will help.
customer_reviews.author: goo

customer_reviews.title: Hard to find your scanned stuff because of the automatic file name.
customer_reviews.text: It does a great job of scanning images. Only problem is when you go to retrieve an image to send in email it is hard to find because it gets filed alphabetically as "MP Navigator EX" in your pictures file. When you go to find it, it gets pushed around every time I download pics. form my cell phone camera so you have to hunt for it. I tried to change the name to start with an A but you wind up with an empty folder.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Bethke

customer_reviews.title: Works fine for (my) casual use.
customer_reviews.text: I can't say I use a scanner much these days, but I do on occasion find the need for one. In that regard, this scanner works just fine. In the past canon has been a bit finicky in keeping their drivers updated, however...so I am not overly confident that in future OS's that it will be supported. I have a perfectly functioning Canon scanner that never got drivers for Windows 7 nor newer versions of OSX...maybe they're not overly to blame...but it doesn't exactly instill brand confidence. The scanner, though...does work fine, and gives nice results. :)
customer_reviews.author: The Active Geek

customer_reviews.title: A Long History Of Good Service
customer_reviews.text: This Canon scanner is my second one, after giving my Canon LIDE-35 hard service since 2003. Besides the quality performance, I got another Canon to help in the user ramp-up time needed to operate the product. I have had it for about 4 months with no failures, and felt confident enough to go ahead and clear it as a quality product in case someone is checking here before purchas for the up-coming Christmas season. The start-up was simple.... clear all prior Canon scanner software from your computer. Install the disc and follow the directions. Operators having used older Canon scanners will find this one a quick study. I recommend.... 4.7 on a 5 scale.
customer_reviews.author: H. J. Rossi

customer_reviews.title: Okay portable scanner -- no improvement over Lide60.
customer_reviews.text: Decent portable scanner. Purchased this because Canon did not update the driver for my (perfectly fine and significantly faster) Canoscan Lide 60. Which irritates me. This one makes some noise on the scan 'return' which gives me pause before endorsing this one. The user interface is good, although the 'old' one was just as informative and more intuitive with the same options. Addendum: I saw a review that complained that this scanner would not work with Mountain Lion. I am using it with Mountain Lion.
customer_reviews.author: LanceManion

customer_reviews.title: Compact, easy, great quality, and works with newer versions of OSX..
customer_reviews.text: I finally had to retire my trusty and road worn CanoScan LiDE30, as it refused to play nicely with OSX 10.8 on my new mac. The Canoscan LiDE110 is very much in line with previous CanoScan models. Integrates easily with newer versions of OSX, solidly built, simple plug and play, stays out of the way and works like it's supposed to. Great image/color quality. Well worth the cost here on Amazon. My only reservation is that it's about 30% thicker than my old LiDE30. Shouldn't these be getting thinner?
customer_reviews.author: M.B. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good
customer_reviews.text: Although simple, it works splendidly. I used it a few times in the last few months and it surprised me that it was fast, accurate and easy to use. It takes its power from the USB cable (it doesn't need an electricity supplier). Personally, I chose to disconnect it from the computer when I am not needing it. However, I discovered that it warms up quite quickly when I connect it for a job. In less than a minute it's ready to go. It also comes with a software that turns a picture of a text into selectable text, and you can save it as a .pdf. I like it and I do recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: CEZAR CEHAN

customer_reviews.title: Nice scanner, AWFUL software
customer_reviews.text: I have owned four scanners in my career, each of which I used extensively; I am quite computer savvy. I say that only so that when I complain about this software, you understand that all I wanted was a scanner that produced scanned documents and pictures. That's all. I did not want 226 MB of installed hover-over-your-work little icons that do in fact require you to wade through online manuals to figure out how to make the buttons work. Counterintuitive? Yeah, just a bit. The scans are nice, I suppose. But it really took me an hour to get to one.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: The little scanner that could
customer_reviews.text: You get a whole lot of scanner for a very small price with this one. I bought it to replace an old UMAX Astra 300P which needed a new bulb (which would have cost nearly as much as the LiDE110 did). I use it to scan receipts for my expense account, but it does a pretty good job with photos as well. The only downside I can see is the occasional anomoly when scanning photos (akin to the effect you used to see on TV when the subject was wearing a finely-striped shirt), but changing the dpi setting has been able to overcome that for me. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this for anyone who wants a cheap multipurpose scanner.
customer_reviews.author: John Lellis

customer_reviews.title: May have to get one for myself
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son for Christmas as he needed a way to scan some of his artwork and drawings into his computer... I set-it up on my computer just to see how it worked and it was great.. simple set-up... one USB cable is it.. no power cord as it uses the USB power to operate... it's a little loud and not the fastest scanner but was well worth the price. If you need a simple scanner for everyday use this one should be good for you.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Axworthy

customer_reviews.title: Good scanner; inexpensive
customer_reviews.text: The most inexpensive scanner I could find. Works well. Powered off of USB, so there's no separate power cord. Really lightweight and compact if you need to move it around. The quality of the scans is good. I'm sure there are tons of more expensive scanners that do a better job, but for my needs, this worked well. Make sure to check the Canon site for updated software. I moved it to a different computer for a short time and when I downloaded the software, I saw that there was new software with new features.
customer_reviews.author: Donna C.

customer_reviews.title: If at first it doesn't work, try,try again...
customer_reviews.text: The original scanner arrived quickly. I also quickly found out it didn't work right (it placed a dark vertical stripe down the middle of EVERY scan!) Tried the scanner on different computers, different OS's. Still didn't work. Canon Tech Support sent me a free "refurbished" unit - it worked perfectly right out of the box. They even paid the shipping (including that used to send the malfunctioning unit back to them.) You win some, you lose some, and some get rained out...
customer_reviews.author: Jerald T.

customer_reviews.title: Great portable/desktop scanner at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I use a Fujitsu ScanSnap as part of my ongoing quest to become mostly paperless. However, sometimes I need to scan something that doesn't feed through the ScanSnap, like my passport, a credit card or driver license. I really did not want to spend a lot of money on a flatbed scanner that would only be used rarely, and would take up a lot of room. This device was under $60 all in from Amazon, was a snap to setup on my MacBook Air (I downloaded the drivers and software from Canon's website), runs off USB power and could fit in my briefcase with my laptop if I needed to take it somewhere.
customer_reviews.author: daveNYC

customer_reviews.title: Delighted with it!
customer_reviews.text: I don't use this thing for color scanning, and the only purpose for it was to use my existing equipment for B/W photocopying. It's a stellar performer, and is the simplest to operate of the past 3 I've owned. It has no external power supply, and gets everything it needs to work from the host computer. I don't use the buttons on the front, but operating it from the computer is very easy. As I said, I've owned several of these over the years and this one is by far the best and easiest, and most cost effective solution I've embraced.
customer_reviews.author: Arnold Ziffel

customer_reviews.title: I like it.
customer_reviews.text: Its simple to use, install software. Run Canon MP navigator EX Scan > save as file. And done. Also has a nice save as PDF function. Save all your documents in 1 PDF file, prety simple. I love it for important documents, had a lot of them piling up, so I just scanned all of them into my PC and stored on mirrored USB sticks. Works great with Win7 x64 Ulti. Sucks it doesnt have its own build in driver with Win7. Need to use Disc cannon provided.
customer_reviews.author: kaori

customer_reviews.title: Complicated, but works
customer_reviews.text: The software that comes with this scanner is a bit complicated, but after a while of using it I was able to figure out how to get the scanner to scan at the quality I wanted. I normally scan images and artwork (sketches), so I often have to send the scanned image through paint or photoshop to crop out the unwanted space. Product works very well, not too noisy when scanning, and the ability to scan multiple documents in one session before saving it all in one go is convenient. Recommended for personal use, not as a gift as you might be bombarded with a lot of questions as to how to get it to work.
customer_reviews.author: The Raven

customer_reviews.title: Great product for my use...
customer_reviews.text: I only use the CanoScan two or three times a month for special business purposes...and it works perfectly for that. I don't need speed or top quality output...thus the four stars rather than 5. It is slow and it takes time to warm up beyond that, but it serves my purposes perfectly, is small, easily stores in a file drawer and, so far, has worked flawlessly. If you just need a basic scanner for the office at a very reasonable price, I'd recommend the CanoScan. If you have major scanning needs or need top quality output, this is probably not the one for you...too slow, manual feeding.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis S.

customer_reviews.title: Cano Scan LiDE 110 review
customer_reviews.text: This scanner (LiDE 110) is in my experience a very good scanner for the price range. I liked it so much, bought another one to use in my bedroom. One bit of caution here: If you use both of the LiDe 110 scanners on the same computer, it won't work. Only the last one you install will work. Both will not, even if you turn one of them off. The reason I had bought two, was going to use one for scanning documents and the other for photographs. If you use the scanners on seperate computers, it great. I really like the simplicity and quality of scan. Good scanner!
customer_reviews.author: Phillip R. Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Canon CanoScan
customer_reviews.text: Just received it, installing was extremely easy (took 5 minutes at the most). I just scanned my first photo and a document and am blown away by the quality for such an inexpensive scanner. Sure, might not be the most professional scanned image ever, but for this price you cannot expect that either. I just need it for occasional use, sending documents mostly but will use it to scan some of my older photos (before digital age) so I always have a copy somewhere. Would definitely recommend this scanner for users like me.
customer_reviews.author: Y. Callewaert

customer_reviews.title: Eats colors a bit, but nothing photoshop can't fix
customer_reviews.text: This is a pretty standard scanner. The software that comes with it is pretty straight forward with no real fiddly stuff. I do traditional media illustrations and comics, and my biggest beef is that it has a hard time scanning in reds and pinks, but I just use photoshop to bring those colors out again. A good scanner for the money. The only reason I can think to replace it is for when I eventually invest in a wide-bed scanner. Unfortunately some of my illustrations are just too big.
customer_reviews.author: Emily C.

customer_reviews.title: I really like this scanner
customer_reviews.text: I really like this scanner. Resolution and color fidelity are great. Copies come out looking almost as good as the originals, even the color copies. The problem is that the driver is quirky and it takes some experimenting to learn to frame the area to be scanned and then to place the file where you want it in memory. Also commendable is the light weight and small footprint. I just wish Canon would make a similar model that can handle 8 1/2 x 14 inch originals.
customer_reviews.author: B-47 Gus

customer_reviews.title: Reviews are spot on - its a great little scanner
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because the Amazon and PC magazine reviews highly recommended it for a scanner at this price point. I have little computer experience. We used it to create a Shutterfly book and scanned literally hundreds of photos, documents, book pages, pins, telegrams etc. Each turned out exactly as promised in the reviews and looked terrific. Even the 3-D and book items scanned well even though that was one of the drawbacks referenced in the reviews. Its easy to use, the resolution is perfect and you can manipulate the scans easily. It loads and saves easily onto your computer and is lightweight/portable.
customer_reviews.author: C. Kane

customer_reviews.title: A Fantastic Budget Scanner
customer_reviews.text: Years ago I discovered the CanoScan line of scanners after paying a whole lot more to buy a better known brand which always broke after a year or two. These CanoScan's are tough little devices, only one cord needed (USB) which provides power and the data connection for scanning. They're clear, crisp and very easy to use. I probably own ten of these units and have never had a single problem with any of them. The CanoScan units are good for casual scanning of documents or photos where you don't need ultra high resolution image scans.
customer_reviews.author: BP

customer_reviews.title: Alright.
customer_reviews.text: It was OK for the price (it was on sale for like 50). I don't regret buying it, but I wouldn't recommended it to a friend. Cons: The cover is filmsy, the driver is really primitive, it's hard to get it working with newer OS's. You don't really have much control over the scanning. Pros: Cheap and it does the job. Its tiny and portable, really light. I'm an artist/designer and I use it for scanning sketches and small drawings.
customer_reviews.author: SebastiAn

customer_reviews.title: Epson 1260 Scanner
customer_reviews.text: I needed a new scanner because I switched to windows 7. Windows 7 would not accept the drivers for my Epson 1260 scanner. When I tried to install the drivers for my scanner, they directed me to another website that would sell me a driver for $40.00. It only cost me $50.00 to get a whole new Cannon scanner. I will never get another Epson product. They could have provided a driver to extend the life of my Epson 1260 scanner. Instead they deceided to not support their equiptment and direct me to another web site. I deceided to buy a new scanner and never buy another Epson product again.
customer_reviews.author: astrlmax

customer_reviews.title: Great Little Scanner
customer_reviews.text: Have been using this regularly at home as I scan everything to prevent piles of paper in drawers, boxes, etc. It has been going strong for about 3 years and still works great. Continues to function well on Windows 8 as well. Nice that it gets its power from the USB cord so no separate power required. It is not wireless but lightweight and small form factor. Not long enough to scan legal size paper.
customer_reviews.author: DBINDC

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: I have used a CanoScan product in the past but in the transition to OS X the driver was never updated. Now I had need of another external scanner and found this one at a very competitive price. This is an excellent scanner. The software that comes with it for the Mac has never been my favorite. However, now the scanner works very well with the standard Mac program Image Capture and even the option to scan right from Preview. So that is how I use it now and I am very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Frederick D

customer_reviews.title: Good Product
customer_reviews.text: While getting ready for a 2 week vacation from the West Coast to the East Coast I bought this scanner and sent it on before me to my Mom's. She has had several thousand pictures of the family while we grew up. The intent was to scan these pics into my laptop which I brought along. In one week I scanned over two thousand pictures using this scanner without any problems at all. Although after a few days and several hours each day to tell u the truth I got bored but the scanner performed flawless. I would recommend this to my best friend and family members.
customer_reviews.author: Dinky Nauger

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good and simple scanner that performs well at a good price
customer_reviews.text: This thing runs on just a USB cable, and so does not require a 2 lb. wall ward power supply. It is light. The lid opens upward on a dual hinge, for scanning out of magazines and books of reasonable size. The associated drivers as well as the wizard-like software make scanning even more simple than the convenience of just a single USB cable to power the unit. Considering that the power is USB derived, this unit scans very well and relatively quickly, at least as fast as many scanners I've used, that depend on large DC powered wall warts. And for the price, I'm very satisfied with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: bachdog

customer_reviews.title: Great for scanning old pictures
customer_reviews.text: I got this scanner to scan old 35mm and 110 film plane slides onto a hard disk. It works very well. The pictures do come out slightly degraded, but I think that is as much due to aging as it is to scanning. The scanner is very easy to use and does exactly what I wanted it to do. Some of the reviews of this machine talk about some problems with the lid. I have had none. It comes with a manual. If you follow the manual. It does exactly what it says it will do.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. G. A great book on sovereignty and forgiveness. Puts trauma in perspective.

customer_reviews.title: Over 9 Years Old and Still Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use. Over 9 years old and still works great. Never had a problem with this unit and quality images.
customer_reviews.author: Long Rider

customer_reviews.title: A fantastic scanner that works like it cost a lot more.
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome scanner for the money. It doesn't take up a lot of space and it is extremely easy to use. I am sure that some people want more from their scanner but this has software to assist you in saving your files as jpeg or pdf. And you can choose multiple pages and combine into one file. Don't let the price fool you. It is a great investment. I needed a reliable scanner for my certifications for Cardiovascular Technology clinicals and it more than filled the bill.
customer_reviews.author: Angela M

customer_reviews.title: "portable" and never fails
customer_reviews.text: I carry this in my laptop bag in a protective sleeve that I had for an old 15" laptop. It's slim and very lightweight. Wonderful that there is exactly one cord -- the usb line that plugs into my laptop. The cheapest "portable" scanner you'll find. The scan quality is just fine, although I'm not trying to scan photos so I can't speak to that. BTW, the software does support multi-page pdf, which was something that wasn't clear when I bought it so you may be wondering. Couldn't ask for anything more.
customer_reviews.author: Contrary Mary

customer_reviews.title: lOVE, lOVE, lOVE
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely lOVE this! I am an artist and my business requires me to scan my artwork into the computer. I love that this doesn't need a power outlet, just the computer that you want to scan into with a USB port. It makes it super portable. It's also super easy to use. You just press a button on the scanner and whether you want it scanned as a PDF, AUTO-SCAN, COPY, or E-MAILED. I love everything about this scanner!
customer_reviews.author: Lau

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this scanner in March 2014 and it worked great until December 2014. There is an apparent mechanical malfunction which repeatedly generates a window saying: Disconnect USB, Open Lock Switch, Reconnect USB. Reinstalling the device driver did not help. The warranty is only 90 days which says something about Canon's confidence in their product.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas W. Doherty

customer_reviews.title: OK for single documents
customer_reviews.text: This scanner works very nicely with documents of all sorts Where it begins to falter is in scanning photos. Frequently, it adds very large blank spaces around a single photo Also frequently, it combines 2-3-4 pictures into one Another irritation is that it does not always recognize pictures that are slightly off-plumb. So, if one has the patience to scan photos one at a time, while being very careful to square the single picture perfectly, it works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Average Customer

customer_reviews.title: great scanner
customer_reviews.text: No problems with the Canon scanner. Had a unit just like it 15 years ago only difference is the software and the USB port was full-size. That made it easier to carry less cords. With the mini size on this unit you have to carry its cords and a full size cord for other items or an adapter. Why they did this, I don't know the scanner is exactly the same size as the one from 15 years ago. So there was plenty of space. Oh and the old one still works but I can't find a driver for it to work with Windows 7. Good luck!
customer_reviews.author: Steveshadow

customer_reviews.title: You can't find a better low-end scanner than this Canon
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product for a low price. I replaced an old HP Photosmart printer/scanner. It was good, but this is better. I use the scanner to scan old family photos. The scans are crisp, and the software is easier to use than the HP software. Multiple pictures copied at the same time almost always scan as separate images. On the HP this frequently didn't happen. The only cons on the product are the absence of a border at the edge of the platen, and the total area scanned is smaller than my old HP (letter not legal size). Nevertheless, at $49 you can't go too far wrong.
customer_reviews.author: UT Longhorns

customer_reviews.title: No problems whatsoever!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a photographer and graphic designer and I honestly I don't understand, what some of the reviewers are complaining about. I unpacked the scanner, moved the switch to "unlock", plugged it into my computer, opened Photoshop and began scanning images (grayscale and color) all within less than 5 minutes. No problems whatsoever. I haven't even bothered to install the CD yet that came with the scanner. It's working just fine without it, if used through Photoshop.
customer_reviews.author: 4seasons

customer_reviews.title: Simple and Cheap
customer_reviews.text: I got this scanner to be able to scan in old family photographs. The hardware is light and just as stated works off a single USB port. It scans reasonably fast and for smaller pictures, using the default settings, you can even lay out several pictures with about an inch gap between them and it will recognize that it's different ones, allowing you to save them each individually, which definitely sped things up. All told, in a single night, I got a little over 250 photos scanned in and documented with it's aid.
customer_reviews.author: John Pool

customer_reviews.title: Slow and clumsy
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly slow, takes almost a minute per page. Software is extremely clumsy and non-intutitive. We had an older model Canoscan that was wonderful, so we bought this one when the old one wouldn't work with my new computer. One of the worst purchases we've ever made. By the time we realized just how bad it was, it was too late to return so we just threw it in the trash and hooked the old one up to an old PC that we now use just for scanning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: super value scanner
customer_reviews.text: Hey this is one of the best scanners out there and is also one of the cheapest.. I bought it for the fact that my old one couldn't make the transition to windows 7.. It is USB powered therefore it doesnt' need a transformer. I recommend don't losing the USB cable that came with the scanner as it may be necessary to power the scanner.. most usb cables are real cheap. don't use a cable too long as it won't work. One downside ... no bundled software however it works well with word , adobe acrobat and other programs.
customer_reviews.author: TeX

customer_reviews.title: Portable, Tough, Reliable - Great Scans at a Great Value
customer_reviews.text: I am a salesman and I use this scanner when I am away from the office and need to make quick high quality scans of customer signed orders. I keep this unit in my car trunk so it gets a lot of abuse just from traveling around and all of the bumps and shaking - not to mention the extreme heat and cold (I live in Northern Indiana). Every time I plug this unit in, it works just like it did the first time. USB powered means I just plug it into my laptop. LED light means it doesn't use much power. I've had it for a few years now and it still works great.
customer_reviews.author: Scott N. Maser

customer_reviews.title: Añty Tedís Kimble-Depue
customer_reviews.text: When I first laid eyes on this scanner I was a bit skeptical at the functions and easy-to-use brief description advertised by the seller, but I later found out that not only did the scanner automatically installed it was as easy as pressing one key to scan any document and convert it into several files. I love this scanner and I would rather buy it separately from a printer or fax machine. Even after being pummeled by ply wood, splashed with soda, and crashing to the floor, it still performs as good as the day I bought it.
customer_reviews.author: Añty Tedís Kimble﻿

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a scanner mainly for scanning photos to use in photobooks. Price was a big consideration, and this moderate price fit the bill. We had a little difficulty installing the software but were persistent. It is very easy to use and small enough to keep alongside my laptop on the kitchen island where I do most of my work. I have made one photobook using my scanned photos and am pleased with the results. I discovered after scanning only one picture at a time that I can put two 4x6 prints on the scanner at once, what a time saver. Overall I am pleased with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It Just Works!
customer_reviews.text: The headline says it all. It just works. It's simple, small, fairly fast, and the quality is great for what I use it for (everything from scanning documents to get rid of paper records to scanning old photographs from the pre-digital days). The software that it comes with makes scanning reams of documents and pictures simple. For example, I can put four photos on and it will identify the photos, crop them, and save them separately. I don't have to mess with any settings or mess with the cropping myself. I absolutely love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: FeetMustFollow

customer_reviews.title: Nice Improvements from Older Models
customer_reviews.text: I had used Canon's older scanner model before (652U or something similar). The older model worked perfectly for a few years under Windows 2000. I have only used the new model for a few days and I use it to scan documents and books, the improvement on speed is a nice surprise. The ease of use (task buttons on scanner) is obviously improved, though the software is a bit peculiar for a person who gets used to normal Windows applications (with a menu, and a few toolbars, something like that). I have not tried other scanner makers (like Epson, HP, etc.) but for the price (I got it from Amazon for $38), I am very satisfied with its performance.
customer_reviews.author: grbooks

customer_reviews.title: Just OK for scanning artwork
customer_reviews.text: I have used this scanner for about a year now- and it is not terrible. The average person would have absolutely no problems with it. But I am an artist, and I work with watercolors a lot. With this scanner, watercolor images do not turn out right when you scan at a high resolution. I want enormous, sharp images. If your paper has any folds, or even any buckling which happens a lot with watercolors, your images will begin to have awful lines in them and a blurriness issue. Yes, you can tell when the images are printed. Since I own an etsy shop that specializes in high quality scans of artwork, this can be a serious problem.
customer_reviews.author: MP

customer_reviews.title: Broke in 1 year with virtually no use
customer_reviews.text: The scanner was great out of the box. It worked well when we got it and tested it. After about a year, however, we tried to use it and successfully scanned about 50 photos, and it stopped working. Total we scanned less than 100 items with this scanner, so it is a disappointment that it broke. It gives "a required file is missing or corrupted, or settings are incorrect" even after driver updates. Used with OS X Yosemite.
customer_reviews.author: Franklin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product. Too bad it is discontinued...
customer_reviews.text: This unit is The Best !!! Can't say enough good about it. Great reproduction of photographs, for one thing. And super light-weight and portable - I've dragged this around with me in my car when on travel many times and it was a wonderful convenience. Too bad it is discontinued...
customer_reviews.author: Ashtabula

customer_reviews.title: Quick, Easy Scanning
customer_reviews.text: Awesome scanner! For our wedding, we wanted to make a slideshow. We originally were just going to go to Staples or Kinkos, but the prices per photo were outrageous. Why can't I just rent a scanner for an hour? Well, I found this online it was the perfect solution. I have since scanned in all my photos and my mother's photos. It was quick, hassle-free and just 2 clicks per scan. I was able to cycle through a LOT of photos in just one evening. A great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney L

customer_reviews.title: Great compact scanner
customer_reviews.text: This the perfect scanner when you don't need or want to have one plugged in and taking up space all the time. It's so thin and light, packs away nicely like a book on a shelf when I'm not using it. Since there's no power cord, I can just pull it out and plug the USB into the side of my monitor. Gets the job done quickly, and the quality is as good as I need for most documents. I don't know how well it would handle photos, but I rarely do that anymore.
customer_reviews.author: gailcnh

customer_reviews.title: a basic scanner
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up but for Win 8.1 a little confusing to use. The software puts two icons on the desktop - one is a manual and the other a sort of toolbox, though from their names it's not clear which is which. There's also a disconnect between the scanner and the toolbox. If you push a button on the scanner - like copy, print, etc, nothing happens, so you have to open the toolbox to get it to work. This is a software issue and it needs work. The scanner itself is fine.
customer_reviews.author: booker d

customer_reviews.title: Nice Little Scanner
customer_reviews.text: I bought this scanner for office use to replace an older HP scanner that quit working. Setup on this new one could not have been simpler and the fact that it's powered via USB and requires no AC adapter is also a plus. Speed is good after the warm up period and scans look great. It get's used several times a day and so far after about a month it's been working fine. The overall size is smaller than I had imagined and it's much smaller than the scanner it replaced taking up about the least amount of desk space possible for a scanner with a flat bed design.
customer_reviews.author: David M.

customer_reviews.title: good value!
customer_reviews.text: Hello, and thanks to all who take the time to give feedback to help the rest of us make our buying decisions. This is my first scanner and I am no expert on the subject. That being said - the CD installed easily on windows XP. I followed the instructions and it worked as advertised. color pictures scan very nicely. For $49 I got to give it 5 stars! Will only down grade if there is mechanicl failure, but I plan to use very rarely so cannot really comment on durability.
customer_reviews.author: Turbo R.

customer_reviews.title: Replaced the old scanner
customer_reviews.text: I owned the earlier version of this scanner and had it for 6 years, problem free, until I upgraded to Windows 7 and no driver was available. I donated the old one to Goodwill since it was still working beautifully. I love the simplicity of it and the fact that it plugs in via USB so there is only one cord. I have it next to my computer and when I want to scan something, I plug it into the front USB port and am ready to go very quickly, unlike the scanner on the printer which takes forever to warm up and start scanning.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Banks

customer_reviews.title: Great stand alone scanner
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a stand alone scanner to scan paperwork, artwork, and photos so I could start storing important things digitally and get rid of the clutter. Everywhere I looked there was nothing but all in one scanner printers which I didn't need another printer taking up space. This scanner is great, it it lightweight, doesn't need a power cord (just uses a USB to connect to the computer) and it has a convienent PDF button to scan directly to a PDF file. This is exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Coralee Lazebnikova

customer_reviews.title: Hardware great/software not so much
customer_reviews.text: The scanner is really quite remarkable. The quality of the scans is great. I love that it uses USB power (no separate brick). Quiet as a mouse, too. The software on the other hand is overly complex and you'll be happy you've used computers for a few years when you use it. If you're a computer beginner, look elsewhere. One really annoying "feature": On WinXP the program takes about a minute to open up after clicking the icon. If they could sort out the software this would be a five-star product.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Scanner!
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box, I was very pleased with the dimensions of this scanner. I thought it was going to be rather small based on the photograph, but it can easily fit a standard sheet of computer paper with some space left on the edges. My favorite feature of this scanner, though, is that you can lay down multiple pictures on the bed, and if there is enough space between the edges of each of them, they will all scan as separate photos. I've only tried this with the software that comes with the scanner. It's super useful and cuts down the time of scanning in photos by a factor of 4!
customer_reviews.author: Gnarlock

customer_reviews.title: Pretty decent
customer_reviews.text: This is a fairly affordable and easy-to-use scanner that was also easy to set up even with Windows 8. Being an LCD scanner, it doesn't require long warmup times. I have had a bit of trouble getting a good white background with black and white pictures scanned in greyscale, but overall, I'm happy with the scanner for lightweight home use. There aren't as many stand-alone flatbed scanners on the market these days and Canon seems to have most of the affordable models. If you need a good basic scanner, this is an excellent choice.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: i have really liked the ability to one button scan to a pdf ...
customer_reviews.text: not as versatile as an old epson i had as far as choices for quality of scan, but works quite well. i have really liked the ability to one button scan to a pdf file, now i can email copies of documents, no land line here so can't fax. i've actually used that feature as much as the picture scanning. i also like the fact i don't need to plug it into an outlet, just one usb cable and away you go. if you've never had a fancier one i think you will love it.
customer_reviews.author: Randy A.

customer_reviews.title: Good portable scanner
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my boss to put in his laptop carrying bag. He needed a portable scanner he could take anywhere. It takes nice scans and the lack of a power brick makes it great for easy transport. I am not sure it would be for everyday, constant use. It does not produce as good of scans as it's larger cousins, but for portability and ease of use, it can't be beat. I have had some compatibility issues with a couple Dell desktops, but I was able to update drivers to fix.
customer_reviews.author: Journeyman7x

customer_reviews.title: Canoscan 4507B002 LiDE110
customer_reviews.text: This is a great piece of equipment. I love it! (1) Good price: $59 including S&H (2) Very easy to load and operate: (1) Load the software (just follow instructions). (2) Connect the USB cable (included ) to PC. (3) Simple operation: It scans beautifully one page at a time; but more than one page can be saved as one PDF doc. (4) Additionally a text or note can be added AFTER the scanning. (5) The PDF doc can be converted to Word doc. I should have bought this piece long time ago.
customer_reviews.author: kingkong

customer_reviews.title: excellent for photo scanning
customer_reviews.text: Looked into many options for digitalizing my 20 or so albums of photographs. This workhorse performed the job well and efficiently and with generally 4 pics per scan did the job more efficiently than dedicated photo scanners. After probably a thousand photos could not be happier with the quality, easy of use and speed of this instrument. Very glad I purchased this product and at the price it was a bargain.
customer_reviews.author: Crossword fiend

customer_reviews.title: Nice scanner for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very lightweight and portable. Easy to setup and prefer the no wall plug needed. The auto scan feature was the only thing I dislike about this model. Almost sent it back as the quality of a magazine page scan was terrible. Once I took the time to create manual scans using the scan driver button it worked much better both in picture quality and text readability. Little crazy to have to open up four or five windows just to get to the scan window. Could be easier to use from the software end. Overall though I am pleased.
customer_reviews.author: D. Ferrick

customer_reviews.title: Great Especially for the Price
customer_reviews.text: The scanner installs easily and works as advertised. Simply plug it into your computer via the included cable, and you're good to go. No need to plug it into the wall for external power. It's small, so it's easy to store. One scan takes under 30 seconds, depending on your settings. I paid just under $60, and the image quality is impressively high especially for the price. I'm scanning some old photos--some that are faded from age--and the scanned versions look better (more vibrant and true to the original colors) than the original print thanks to the "auto-correction" setting. It doesn't seem to overcorrect, either. Highly satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: AdotHam

customer_reviews.title: Lide Canon scanner
customer_reviews.text: I owned an earlier version of this scanner (630U), but when I upgraded to Windows 7 64 bit my old scanner was no longer supported. (The old scanner which I purchased in 2001 was still working fine,) I like the idea of the scanner being powered via USB -no need for an electric socket. My scanning is limited (5-10 page per month) and so speed is not an issue. As others have stated, this is a slow scanner by current standards and not a good candidate for heavy office use. If not for the speed issue it would be a five star item.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Gentile

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE this scanner
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this scanner. It's tiny, lightweight, and can be carried in a backpack if need be. It's incredibly quiet for a scanner and has a bunch of fancy modes that I honestly never use, but hey, extra features are always nice. If you're an artist on the move who needs to scan stuff no larger than 8.5"x11", this is really super great.
customer_reviews.author: Rose

customer_reviews.title: Love Canon Scanner!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy install consisting of a CD, plugging scanner into computer, and moving switch on scanner to unlock. Have not read manual yet, but software is a breeze to use: very intuitive. Auto settings seems all I need, although you can customize dpi etc. It is probably not for heavy duty use and as others have mentioned, not appropriate for trying to scan anything thicker than an average size magazine. But for my occasional home projects absolutely perfect and a great value at this price! Amazon shipping was fast and packaging top notch, as usual.
customer_reviews.author: M-in-Denver

customer_reviews.title: A Pleasant Surprise
customer_reviews.text: This goes far and above my expectations. I just needed a cheap document scanner. This thing is awesome. One button and you have a PDF of your scan...it even does multiple pages...it just waits for you to put the next page in, you click NEXT and it continues, until you are done. Worth the price. I haven't done any high quality photo scans, nor do I plan to, so I can't verify color accuracy, or resolution. For business purposes or for a light travel scanner. This is your solution.
customer_reviews.author: Traveler Guy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Scanner, Especially For The Price
customer_reviews.text: This scanner is compact, relatively quiet, very affordable and performs like a charm. It doesn't require a separate power cord so less wires to deal with. You only need to plug in the USB cord into your computer. What I like about this scanner is that the buttons outside make it very easy to use. For example, if you press the PDF button, then it will automatically scan your document into a PDF format without you needing to do anything else. So sweet!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I was actually pleasantly surprised. I did not expect much for under $60, but I needed a scanner quickly, and so I was able to get this within a couple of days with Amazon Prime. I'm using it every few weeks now and I have no issues at all. The quality is really good. I can't comment much on the software, since I haven't had much time to play with it, but it appears there are plenty of options and it looks clean.
customer_reviews.author: B.K.

customer_reviews.title: Pretty Good Scanner
customer_reviews.text: I like this scanner in that it is compact and can be taken anywhere with you. It plugs into your computer and requires no further power source. That is a plus. The negatives for me were that it took longer than expected to scan in a photo or document, you can only scan in flat objects, and I had hoped form something that took a little more time. The quality is pretty good but I still had hoped for a little better for my photos and documents.
customer_reviews.author: K in Texas

customer_reviews.title: Very compact, does the job
customer_reviews.text: This very compact and efficient scanner, which is powered through the USB cable, replaced a semi-bulky Epson inkjet/scanner combo with inkjets that had long since clogged. (I used to print a lot of photos, but the advent of smartphones, tablets and digital frames has pretty much obsoleted that practice.) I bought this model because i have an older version at work that I was pretty happy with. This newer model with its minimal footprint on my desk surface is much higher res and much faster. Image quality is fine too.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Harris

product_meta.title: Canon LiDE110 Color Image Scanner (Discontinued by Manufacturer)
product_meta.description:
Ultra Compact Scanner with up to 2400 dpi

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


OVERVIEW

CANON CANOSCAN LIDE110 COLOR IMAGE SCANNER
 

Ultra Compact Scanner with up to 2400 dpi1

 * "Auto Scan Mode" automatically adjusts settings by detecting what you are scanning
 * High-speed letter size color scanning in approx. 16 seconds2
 * Just one USB cable for data and power
 * Advanced Z-lidTM expansion top for scanning bulky items



Click here for a larger image 
 Are you looking for a dedicated scanning solution with great quality, versatility and a compact design? Then the CanoScan LiDE110 Color Image Scanner is sure to impress. The CanoScan LiDE110 features the quality, speed and ease of use you need with a maximum resolution of 2400 x 4800 (Optical) dpi1 for excellent scanning quality for both photos and documents. 

 You’ll immediately notice how easy the CanoScan LiDE110 is to use. Auto Document Fix automatically delivers beautiful, easy-to-view scans by advanced image analysis and area-by-area data correction while the Auto Scan Mode feature automatically detects the original and saves its appropriate settings. Need to share information? The CanoScan LiDE110 has Four EZ Buttons that enable you to scan, copy, email or create a PDF faster than ever. 

 Speaking of speed, the CanoScan LiDE110 delivers a letter size color scan in approximately 16 seconds2! You’ll also be able to proudly join the Generation Green initiative as its one USB Cable for data and power provides lower power consumption. 


FEATURES & BENEFITS

 

SPEED & QUALITY



Excellent Resolution:
When you combine 2400 x 4800 maximum color resolution with a vivid 48-bit color depth and over 281 trillion possible colors, the results will astound you. Continue your scanning brilliance with tremendous 19,200 x 19,200 (Interpolated) software enhanced scans.1 

 

EASE OF USE



EZ Buttons:
Have the flexibility with your originals as you utilize the Four EZ Buttons to automate the entire scanning process. Copy, scan and create email attachments or PDF files simply with the push of a button. 


 Auto Scan Mode:
At last, you have the ability to bring eight steps into one as you scan a photo, document, business card, textbook or personal notebook and have it automatically recognized. In addition, the original is automatically cropped to proper size, scanned and saved in the appropriate file format. All of this is achieved with the press of a single button. 


Auto Document Fix:
Auto Document Fix delivers beautiful, easy-to-view scans by advanced image analysis and area-by-area data correction, automatically. So, your document text can be darkened with pronounced edges for clear, sharp text that’s easy to read, and pictures will maintain color tone and contrast 

Advanced Z-Lid:
The Z-Lid extends up and over the platen to scan large items such as notebooks, textbooks and other thick documents. 

One Plug Scanning:
Consolidate the number of wires in your work area as one simple cable provides a USB 2.0 Hi-Speed connection and power. 

3 Way Positioning:
Scan with flexibility to accommodate your work station as you can setup the LiDE210 in three positions such as upright, portrait and landscape. 

 

CONNECTIVITY



Hi-Speed USB:
Scan and transfer images to your computer with the fastest possible scanning speeds with this connection. The Hi-Speed USB Interface also allows for quick previews of your images to your computer. 

 

ADDITIONAL FEATURES & BENEFITS


Create PDF Files:
Variable PDF files creation functions feature Searchable PDF files, Multi-Page PDF files or Auto Direction correction.
